official_title: To amend the Higher Education Act of 1965 to prevent Federal student assistance need analysis from penalizing parents for investing in prepaid tuition programs.
short_title: Tuition Investment Planning Protection Act of 1997

summary.text: Tuition Investment Planning Protection Act of 1997 - Amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to provide that, in determining a student's eligibility for student assistance, tuition prepayment plans shall not be considered estimated financial assistance. Treats any such plan, in determinations of a student's need for such assistance, as an asset of the parents of a dependent student or as an asset of an independent student.
